signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) : Set

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 3.4.1.  Interestingly, the definition does not require S to be a subset of X. -/
abbrev image {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) : Set :=
  X.replace (P := fun x y ↦ f x = y ∧ x.val ∈ S) (by simp_all)

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) (y : Object) : y ∈ image f S ↔ ∃ x : X, x.val ∈ S ∧ f x = y

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 3.4.1 -/
theorem mem_image {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) (y : Object) : y ∈ image f S ↔ ∃ x : X, x.val ∈ S ∧ f x = y := by
  grind [replacement_axiom]

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) : image f S = Y.specify (fun y ↦ ∃ x : X, x.val ∈ S ∧ f x = y)

ref.pp:
/-- Alternate definition of image using axiom of specification -/
theorem image_eq_specify {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) :
    image f S = Y.specify (fun y ↦ ∃ x : X, x.val ∈ S ∧ f x = y) := by sorry

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) : (image f S : _root_.Set Object) = Subtype.val '' (f '' {x | x.val ∈ S})

ref.pp:
/-- Connection with Mathlib's notion of image.  Note the need to utilize the `Subtype.val` coercion
  to make everything type consistent.
-/
theorem image_eq_image {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) :
    (image f S : _root_.Set Object) = Subtype.val '' (f '' {x | x.val ∈ S}) := by ext; simp; grind

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) : image f S ⊆ Y

ref.pp: theorem image_in_codomain {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (S : Set) : image f S ⊆ Y := by intro _ h; rw [mem_image] at h; grind

signature.pp: : nat → nat

ref.pp:
/-- Example 3.4.2 -/
abbrev f_3_4_2 : nat → nat := fun n ↦ (2 * n : ℕ)

theorem image_f_3_4_2 : image f_3_4_2 { 1, 2, 3 } = { 2, 4, 6 } :=
  by
  ext; simp only [mem_image, mem_triple, f_3_4_2]
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨_, (_ | _ | _), rfl⟩ <;> simp_all
  rintro (_ | _ | _); map_tacs [use 1; use 2; use 3]
  all_goals simp_all

/-- Example 3.4.3 is written using Mathlib's notion of image. -/
example : (fun n : ℤ ↦ n ^ 2) '' {-1, 0, 1, 2} = {0, 1, 4} := by aesop

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 3.4.4 (inverse images).
  Again, it is not required that U be a subset of Y.
-/
abbrev preimage {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) : Set :=
  X.specify (P := fun x ↦ (f x).val ∈ U)

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) (x : X) : x.val ∈ preimage f U ↔ (f x).val ∈ U

ref.pp:
@[simp]
theorem mem_preimage {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) (x : X) : x.val ∈ preimage f U ↔ (f x).val ∈ U := by
  rw [specification_axiom']

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) (x : Object) : x ∈ preimage f U ↔ ∃ x' : X, x'.val = x ∧ (f x').val ∈ U

ref.pp:
/-- A version of mem_preimage that does not require x to be of type X.
-/
theorem mem_preimage' {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) (x : Object) :
    x ∈ preimage f U ↔ ∃ x' : X, x'.val = x ∧ (f x').val ∈ U :=
  by
  constructor
  . intro h; by_cases hx : x ∈ X
    . use ⟨x, hx⟩; have := mem_preimage f U ⟨_, hx⟩; simp_all
    . grind [specification_axiom]
  . rintro ⟨x', rfl, hfx'⟩; rwa [mem_preimage]

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) : ((preimage f U) : _root_.Set Object) = Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' {y | y.val ∈ U})

ref.pp:
/-- Connection with Mathlib's notion of preimage. -/
theorem preimage_eq {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) :
    ((preimage f U) : _root_.Set Object) = Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' {y | y.val ∈ U}) := by ext; simp

ref.pp: theorem preimage_in_domain {X Y : Set} (f : X → Y) (U : Set) : (preimage f U) ⊆ X := by intro _ _; aesop

/-- Example 3.4.6 -/
theorem preimage_f_3_4_2 : preimage f_3_4_2 { 2, 4, 6 } = { 1, 2, 3 } :=
  by
  ext; simp only [mem_preimage', mem_triple, f_3_4_2]; constructor
  · rintro ⟨x, rfl, (_ | _ | _)⟩ <;> simp_all <;> omega
  rintro (rfl | rfl | rfl); map_tacs [use 1; use 2; use 3]
  all_goals simp
theorem image_preimage_f_3_4_2 : image f_3_4_2 (preimage f_3_4_2 { 1, 2, 3 }) ≠ { 1, 2, 3 } := by sorry

/-- Example 3.4.7 (using the Mathlib notion of preimage) -/
example : (fun n : ℤ ↦ n ^ 2) ⁻¹' {0, 1, 4} = {-2, -1, 0, 1, 2} :=
  by
  ext; refine ⟨?_, by aesop⟩; rintro (_ | _ | h)
  on_goal 3 => have : 2 ^ 2 = (4 : ℤ) := (by norm_num); rw [← h, sq_eq_sq_iff_eq_or_eq_neg] at this
  all_goals aesop

/-- This coercion has to be a `CoeOut` rather than a
`Coe` because the input type `X → Y` contains
parameters not present in the output type `Output` -/
instance inst_coe_of_fun {X Y : Set} : CoeOut (X → Y) Object where coe := coe_of_fun

@[simp]
theorem coe_of_fun_inj {X Y : Set} (f g : X → Y) : (f : Object) = (g : Object) ↔ f = g := by simp [coe_of_fun]

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (F : Object) : F ∈ (X ^ Y) ↔ ∃ f : Y → X, f = F

ref.pp:
/-- Axiom 3.11 (Power set axiom) --/
@[simp]
theorem powerset_axiom {X Y : Set} (F : Object) : F ∈ (X ^ Y) ↔ ∃ f : Y → X, f = F :=
  SetTheory.powerset_axiom X Y F

/-- Example 3.4.9 -/
abbrev f_3_4_9_a : ({ 4, 7 } : Set) → ({0, 1} : Set) := fun x ↦ ⟨0, by simp⟩

noncomputable abbrev f_3_4_9_b : ({ 4, 7 } : Set) → ({0, 1} : Set) := fun x ↦
  if x.val = 4 then ⟨0, by simp⟩ else ⟨1, by simp⟩

noncomputable abbrev f_3_4_9_c : ({ 4, 7 } : Set) → ({0, 1} : Set) := fun x ↦
  if x.val = 4 then ⟨1, by simp⟩ else ⟨0, by simp⟩
abbrev f_3_4_9_d : ({ 4, 7 } : Set) → ({0, 1} : Set) := fun x ↦ ⟨1, by simp⟩

theorem example_3_4_9 (F : Object) :
    F ∈ ({0, 1} : Set) ^ ({ 4, 7 } : Set) ↔ F = f_3_4_9_a ∨ F = f_3_4_9_b ∨ F = f_3_4_9_c ∨ F = f_3_4_9_d :=
  by
  rw [powerset_axiom]
  refine ⟨?_, by aesop⟩
  rintro ⟨f, rfl⟩
  have h1 := (f ⟨4, by simp⟩).property
  have h2 := (f ⟨7, by simp⟩).property
  simp [coe_of_fun_inj] at *
  obtain _ | _ := h1 <;> obtain _ | _ := h2
  map_tacs [left; (right; left); (right; right; left); (right; right; right)]
  all_goals ext ⟨_, hx⟩; simp at hx; grind

signature.pp: (X : Set) : Set
{X : Set} (x : Object) : x ∈ powerset X ↔ ∃ Y : Set, x = Y ∧ Y ⊆ X

ref.pp:
/-- Exercise 3.4.6 (i) -/
@[simp]
theorem mem_powerset {X : Set} (x : Object) : x ∈ powerset X ↔ ∃ Y : Set, x = Y ∧ Y ⊆ X := by sorry

signature.pp: (X : Set) : ∃ (Z : Set), ∀ x, x ∈ Z ↔ ∃ Y : Set, x = Y ∧ Y ⊆ X

(a b c x : Object) :
  x ∈ powerset { a, b, c } ↔
    x = (∅ : Set) ∨
      x = ({ a } : Set) ∨
        x = ({ b } : Set) ∨
          x = ({ c } : Set) ∨
            x = ({ a, b } : Set) ∨ x = ({ a, c } : Set) ∨ x = ({ b, c } : Set) ∨ x = ({ a, b, c } : Set)

ref.pp:
/-- Remark 3.4.11 -/
theorem powerset_of_triple (a b c x : Object) :
    x ∈ powerset { a, b, c } ↔
      x = (∅ : Set) ∨
        x = ({ a } : Set) ∨
          x = ({ b } : Set) ∨
            x = ({ c } : Set) ∨
              x = ({ a, b } : Set) ∨ x = ({ a, c } : Set) ∨ x = ({ b, c } : Set) ∨ x = ({ a, b, c } : Set) :=
  by
  simp only [mem_powerset, subset_def, mem_triple]
  refine ⟨?_, by aesop⟩
  rintro ⟨Y, rfl, hY⟩; by_cases a ∈ Y <;> by_cases b ∈ Y <;> by_cases c ∈ Y
  on_goal 8 => left
  on_goal 4 => right; left
  on_goal 6 => right; right; left
  on_goal 7 => right; right; right; left
  on_goal 2 => right; right; right; right; left
  on_goal 3 => right; right; right; right; right; left
  on_goal 5 => right; right; right; right; right; right; left
  on_goal 1 => right; right; right; right; right; right; right
  all_goals congr; ext; simp; grind

  SetTheory.union_axiom A x

/-- Indexed union -/
abbrev iUnion (I : Set) (A : I → Set) : Set :=
  union (I.replace (P := fun α S ↦ S = A α) (by grind))

  by
  rw [union_axiom]; constructor
  . simp_all [replacement_axiom]; grind
  grind [replacement_axiom]

noncomputable abbrev index_example : ({ 1, 2, 3 } : Set) → Set := fun i ↦
  if i.val = 1 then { 2, 3 } else if i.val = 2 then { 3, 4 } else { 4, 5 }

  refine ⟨by aesop, ?_⟩; rintro (_ | _ | _); map_tacs [use 1; use 2; use 3]

/-- Exercise 3.4.10 -/
theorem inter_iInter {I J : Set} (hI : I ≠ ∅) (hJ : J ≠ ∅) (A : (I ∪ J : Set) → Set) :
    iInter I hI (fun α ↦ A ⟨α.val, by simp [α.property]⟩) ∩ iInter J hJ (fun α ↦ A ⟨α.val, by simp [α.property]⟩) =
      iInter (I ∪ J) (union_of_nonempty hI hJ) A :=
  by sorry

signature.pp: {X I : Set} (hI : I ≠ ∅) (A : I → Set) : X \ iUnion I A = iInter I hI (fun α ↦ X \ A α)

ref.pp:
/-- Exercise 3.4.11 -/
theorem compl_iUnion {X I : Set} (hI : I ≠ ∅) (A : I → Set) : X \ iUnion I A = iInter I hI (fun α ↦ X \ A α) := by sorry

signature.pp: {X I : Set} (hI : I ≠ ∅) (A : I → Set) : X \ iInter I hI A = iUnion I (fun α ↦ X \ A α)

ref.pp:
/-- Exercise 3.4.11 -/
theorem compl_iInter {X I : Set} (hI : I ≠ ∅) (A : I → Set) : X \ iInter I hI A = iUnion I (fun α ↦ X \ A α) := by sorry
